title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’s Nine Lives
summary: For decades, he occupied a special stripe of the celebrity stratosphere. Now the man who helped turn rap into a global concern has escaped a sex-trafficking conviction.

title: After Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Verdict, the Testimony of Cassie and ‘Jane’ Lingers
summary: Two of Mr. Combs’s former girlfriends gave days of harrowing testimony of abuse, but jurors weren’t convinced those experiences with escorts were sex trafficking.

title: Will House Conservatives Cave Again on Trump’s Big Bill?
summary: Fiscal hawks have repeatedly threatened to bring down their party’s agenda out of debt fears, only to back down after pressure from party leaders and President Trump.

title: Inside Trump’s Charm Offensive as He Woos Holdout Republicans
summary: President Trump worked the phones and welcomed Republicans to the White House to cajole them into supporting his megabill. They left with signed merchandise and photos of the Oval Office.

title: Bryan Kohberger Pleads Guilty to Killing 4 Idaho Students
summary: Bryan Kohberger pleaded guilty to the 2022 murders that shook the University of Idaho campus. Under a plea agreement, he avoids the death penalty.

title: The Serial Killer Expert Who Taught Bryan Kohberger
summary: Dr. Katherine Ramsland was Bryan Kohberger’s professor before he moved to the Pacific Northwest, where he is expected to plead guilty to killing four University of Idaho students.

title: Justice Dept. Explores Using Criminal Charges Against Election Officials
summary: Such a path could drastically raise the stakes for federal investigations of state or county officials, bringing the department and the threat of criminalization into the election system.

title: Top F.D.A. Official Overrode Scientists on Covid Shots
summary: Records show that a top U.S. regulator rejected the recommendations of agency experts and limited the use of Covid vaccines.

title: C.I.A. Says Its Leaders Rushed Report on Russia Interference in 2016 Vote
summary: But the new review of the earlier assessment does not dispute the conclusion that Russia favored the election of Donald J. Trump.

title: Somebody Explain Why Everybody Loves Phil Rosenthal
summary: The host of “Somebody Feed Phil” and creator of “Everybody Loves Raymond” has become a global star with little more than fun-guy charm. That’s enough.

title: Abrego Garcia Was Beaten and Tortured in El Salvador Prison, Lawyers Say
summary: Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia was made to kneel overnight, denied bathroom access and confined in an overcrowded cell with bright lights and no windows, his lawyers say.

title: Illegal Border Crossings Plunge to Lowest Level in Decades
summary: Border Patrol agents made just over 6,000 arrests in June, according to government figures, a sign that President Trump’s hard-line immigration policies are working to keep people out.

title: What the Supreme Court’s Birthright Ruling Means for Trump’s Power
summary: A recent Supreme Court ruling could allow President Trump’s order ending birthright citizenship to go into effect in some states. Abbie VanSickle, a reporter covering the United States Supreme Court for The New York Times, explains how the decision also upends the power of federal judges to freeze policies for the entire country.

title: Judge Rejects Trump’s Attempt to Stop Migrant Asylum Claims
summary: The judge wrote that neither the Constitution nor federal immigration law gave the president the authority to “adopt an alternative immigration system.”

title: Trump Floats Ideas to Help Farmers and Hotel Owners Who Employ Undocumented Workers
summary: President Trump has floated ideas about helping certain industries that rely on immigrant labor, but the White House has yet to release a concrete plan about what’s in store.

title: Amid Warnings of Iranian Sleeper Cells, a History of Failed Plots
summary: For high-stakes plots like an effort to kill President Trump, Iran has turned to common criminals, raising questions about its capabilities inside the U.S.

title: Pentagon Again Shifts Assessment of Damage to Iran’s Nuclear Program
summary: The appraisal that Iran’s nuclear hopes had been set back 1 to 2 years by U.S. and Israeli bombings was the latest in a shifting series of pronouncements.

title: Paramount’s Settlement With Trump Is a Humbling Moment for ’60 Minutes’
summary: After an astonishing concession to a sitting president, the country’s most popular television news program faces the prospect of new ownership and a chilled environment for the First Amendment.

title: He’s Ringo. And Nobody Else Is.
summary: As he turns 85, one of the last surviving Beatles is still musically curious, dispensing his signature wisdom, and preaching the gospel of peace and love.

title: Pentagon Is Reviewing Which Countries Receive U.S. Weapons
summary: President Trump’s decision to pause the delivery of some air defense interceptors and precision-guided munitions to Ukraine is part of a broader effort.

title: Mamdani Says Trump Is Attacking Him to Divert Focus From G.O.P. Agenda
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City, has been targeted by the president and other Republicans since his success in the primary.

title: A Potential Mamdani Mayorship Strikes Fear in the Real Estate Industry
summary: The Democratic nominee has called for freezing the rent on a million apartments.

title: The Real Impact of the Supreme Court’s Planned Parenthood Decision
summary: The case was about much more than abortion.

title: 10 Ways of Making Sense of Zohran Mamdani’s Win
summary: New York City’s surprising primary result has ramifications for the whole country.

title: Combs Was Acquitted of the Most Serious Charges Against Him
summary: Also, House Republicans were divided over the party’s big policy bill. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: Skydiving Plane With 15 Aboard Crashes on Takeoff in New Jersey
summary: The plane, a Cessna 208B, went off the end of a runway as it was taking off from a small airport in Gloucester County, according to the F.A.A. Victims were being treated at the scene, officials said.

title: 454 Hints That a Chatbot Wrote Part of a Biomedical Researcher’s Paper
summary: Scientists show that the frequency of a set of words seems to have increased in published study abstracts since ChatGPT was released into the world.

title: Chicago Suburb Will Buy Pope Leo XIV’s Boyhood Home
summary: Officials in Dolton, Ill., called the purchase a rare opportunity. But some residents questioned whether the village, grappling with a deficit and potholes, could afford it.

title: 7 Missing After Fireworks Warehouse Explodes in Northern California
summary: The cause of the explosion in Esparto, Calif., remained unclear. Two people were injured, and a one-mile evacuation order was still in effect on Wednesday afternoon, officials said.
